column4: I am looking for a command to unzip a bunch of tar.gz files in one directory in one shot.  Lill' help?
sorry. Can'T follow last 2 parts
What do you mean?
what is this? for i in *.tar.gz; do tar zxf "$i"; done

'for i in *.tar.gz; do .... ; done' is a look that takes every file that matches *.tar.gz and puts it in the variable "$i" one by one to 'do' something with it.  the command in the middle is the unzip command for .tar.gz files
I am sorry but I do not follow how to execute any of those commands. I am cd to the directory already.
Oh I see, you want to do it using the graphical thingy; have to find someone else to help you with that then
no
I want to do it in the command line but I enterd the commands and get nothing
I am missing something
Do you mean they printed nothing, or that no files have appeared?
no return , no output
Well, no output means it was successful. o.o
where did it unzip to?
The directory, like you said...
unzip commands on linux generally extract to the current directory (so you cd to it first)
I am in the directory. There are no files from an unzip
so I should copy that line and execute it as is?
Are the .tar.gz files in the same directory?
yes
I am in the directory
then the 'for ..... done' command should work
